TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ScriptFunction extends Microsoft.JScript.JSObject

Docs.summary: Represents a prototype-based object that is defined by a constructor function. Most of the constructor function classes, such as , , , and , inherit from this class. This class belongs to the objects and functions category.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject parent, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The parent prototype of the object that this function constructs.
The name of the object that this function constructs.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The parent is the object to which the object delegates requests for properties or methods that it does not implement itself. For example, when you create a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberObject> by using a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberConstructor>, the parent is a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberPrototype>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object CreateInstance(object[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The arguments to pass to the constructor.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the prototype-based object, passing in the specified arguments.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance class Microsoft.JScript.ScriptObject GetPrototypeForConstructedObject() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the prototype object for this constructor function.
Docs.returns: The prototype object for this constructor function.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The prototype is the object to which the object delegates requests for properties or methods that it does not implement itself. For example, when you create a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberObject> by using a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberConstructor>, the prototype is a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberPrototype>.

Docs.summary: Stores the number of elements that are in the parameter of the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Invoke (object thisob, object[] args);
.method public hidebysig instance object Invoke(object thisob, object[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that this method is acting upon.
The arguments to pass to the method.
Docs.summary: Invokes a method of the prototype-based object, passing in the specified arguments.
Docs.returns: The result of the call to the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:Microsoft.JScript.ScriptFunction.Invoke%2A> often acts as a constructor or create instance call.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object InvokeMember (string name, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, object target, object[] args, System.Reflection.ParameterModifier[] modifiers, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, string[] namedParameters);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object InvokeMember(string name, valuetype System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, class System.Reflection.Binder binder, object target, object[] args, valuetype System.Reflection.ParameterModifier[] modifiers, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, string[] namedParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the member to invoke.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies how the search for members is conducted by reflection.
An object that performs type conversion from actual argument type to formal argument type.
The object on which to invoke the member. This must be the current script object.
An array of objects that contains the number, order, and type of the parameters of the member to be invoked. This is an empty array if there are no parameters.
An array that has the same length as the args parameter. It represents the invoked member's argument attributes in the metadata.
Provides information about a specific culture or locale. Used to format numbers, dates, and strings correctly.
Docs.returns: The return value of the call to the member.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int length { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of elements that are in the parameter of the method.
Docs.value: The number of elements that are in the parameter of the method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the prototype object for this constructor function.
Docs.value: The prototype object for this constructor function.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The prototype is the object to which the object delegates requests for properties or methods that it does not implement itself. For example, when you create a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberObject> by using a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberConstructor>, the prototype is a <xref:Microsoft.JScript.NumberPrototype>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the constructor function.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the name of the constructor function and a placeholder for the code.
